alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Montgomery; San Jacinto; Walker; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Burleson, Grimes, southern Brazos, northern Washington, northwestern Montgomery, west central San Jacinto and Walker Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1039 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Riverside to near Huntsville to near Anderson to 6 miles southwest of Caldwell. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... College Station, Bryan, Huntsville, Navasota, Willis, Caldwell, Washington, Somerville, New Waverly, Montgomery, Snook, Millican, Anderson, Lake Somerville Dam, Huntsville State Park, Kyle Field, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Lyons, Dobbin and Plantersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Montgomery; San Jacinto; Walker; Washington
